TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit AutomationEventArgs extends System.EventArgs

Docs.summary: Provides data for [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] events that are passed to an delegate.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Windows.Automation.AutomationEvent eventId) cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code shows how a UI Automation provider might create an<xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationEventArgs> and raise the event.
[!code-cs[UIAFragmentProvider_snip#122](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/UIAFragmentProvider_snip.ElementProvider/ListFragment.cs#122)] [!code-vb[UIAFragmentProvider_snip#122](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/UIAFragmentProviderVB/ListFragment.vb#122)]

## Remarks If a client has added event handlers for more than one event using the same <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationEventHandler> instance, EventId can be used to identify the event that the delegate should process.
## Examples In the following example, the event handler checks the EventId of the event and handles the event accordingly.
[!code-vb[UIAClient_snip#173](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/UIAClient_snip/ClientForm.vb#173)] [!code-cs[UIAClient_snip#173](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/CustomElementClient/ClientForm.cs#173)]
